content.description: Sit start matched on the large sidepull. From there, move slight right to edges, then head straight up through further edges to reach a solid finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a good landing, but there are are some neighboring rocks.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's south face.

content.description: Stand start with the horizontal shelf about five feet off the deck. From there, climb slight left and up through a series of edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two will do. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's north face.

content.description: Sit start matched on an edge. From there, climb up through edges and chickenheads to reach an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a good landing with a few rocks/tree stump behind.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's north face.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched on the jug of the blunt arete. From there, stand tall to a right hand edge, place a left heel hook, reach a left hand edge, set, make a small dyno to the lip, match, rock onto the false summit, then finish up the remaining features to reach an easy mantle.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The immediate landing is great, but there is a rock close behind. Despite its presence, the rock isn't much of an issue, as most would probably sending you flying off to the right, a safe zone.
content.location: It climbs the blunt south face arete of Multiplex.

content.description: Squat start matched on the sloping lip. From there, throw a heel on, gain a left hand sidepull, follow to the sloping edge, then make a big right hand move, and finish up the good edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads, but the landing is quite good.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's north face.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched on the diagonal undercling shelf. From there, figure out a way to get both feet on the rock, reach a left hand mono/finger-stack, follow to the right hand sidepull mail slot next to the left hand, reach a right hand pinch, then a left hand edge, bring the feet up, match at the lip, rock on to the false summit, then walk around the remaining feature to the west, and finish up the features for an easy mantle.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work fine. The landing is good, but there is a rock that makes it a bit uneven.
content.location: It climbs the southeast section of Multiplex.
